Text: Berkeley High Jacket:  There are five sections in the paper: news, opinion, features, entertainment, and sports.
Triplets: <Berkeley High Jacket
3:
--------------------
Text: Berkeley High Jacket:  The staff of the "Jacket" includes more than one hundred student editors, reporters, photographers, and videographers as well as one faculty advisor.

<The Jacket's editorial board
5:
--------------------
Text: Berkeley High Jacket:  The name of the paper is taken from the mascot of Berkeley High School, the Yellowjacket.
Triplets:<Berkeley High Jacket
6:
--------------------
<Text: Berkeley High Jacket:  From around the mid-1950s into the early 1960s, the paper was a daily, printed by students in the school's own print shop.>
Triplets:<Berkeley High Jacket
7:
--------------------
<Text: Berkeley High Jacket:  Most issues at that time were one-sheets, that is, two-sided, 8½ x 11 inch pages.>
Triplets:<Most issues
8:
--------------------
<Text: Berkeley High Jacket:  Friday issues were usually four pages long.>
